intro: Phyllolobium tingriense, commonly known as the Tingri phyllolobium, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive lobed structure, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research.
